aors.util
Class JavaRandom

java.lang.Object
  aors.util.JavaRandom

public class JavaRandom
extends java.lang.Object

A class for enabling some random number functions.

All methods are available for all simulation entities and can be used in AORSML.

JavaRandom wraps up the Math.random() method that comes with Java

public static double exponential(double val)
Returns the next value of an exponentially distributed random variable with the given parameter.

Parameters:

Returns:

uniform

public static double uniform()
Returns the next value of an uniformally distributed random variable between 0 and 1.

Using this method is equal to use uniform(0, 1).

Returns:
the next value of an uniformally distributed random variable between 0 and 1

uniform

public static double uniform(double a,
                             double b)
Returns the next value of an uniformally distributed random variable between a and b.

Parameters:
a - the lowest possible value
b - the highest possible value
Returns:
the next value of an uniformally distributed random variable between a and b

uniformInt

public static int uniformInt(int val)
Returns the next int value of an uniformally distributed random integer between 0(inclusive) and n(inclusive).

Using this method is equal to use uniformInt(0, val).

Parameters:
val - the bound on the random number to be returned. Must be positive.
Returns:
the next int value of an uniformally distributed random integer between 0 and n
See Also:
Random.nextInt(int n)

b - the highest possible value
